p: Currently, the prophylaxis against flystrike relies on synthetic insecticides, such as organophosphates and insect growth regulators (benzoylphenyl ureas, cyromazine and dicyclanil) [ 16; 17; 12] and, especially for Merino lambs in Australia's extensive wool industry, on painful surgical husbandry procedures such as the docking and the mulesing [ 18; 19]. However, the side effects of synthetic insecticides, such as the development of insect resistance [ 20], the harmful effects on sheep [ 21], farmers [ 22], and the environment [ 23], as well as the rising concerns about animal welfare [ 24] have made alternative strategies a high priority.
